name: Eva Green
description:
Career trajectory of EVERY young, good-looking, European actress (Eva Green, Juliette Binoche, Emmanuelle Beart, Sophie Marceau, Famke Janssen, Marion Cotillard, Franka Potente, Monica Bellucci, Melanie Laurent, etc, etc, etc):

Debut in a film in your native country
Win the local Best (Young) Actress award
Get cast in a major Hollywood film
Play the exotic love interest to the English-speaking star
Steal hearts with your exotic accent
Star in another Hollywood movie
Fail to live up to previous success
Be accused in your native country of selling out
Try to hang on by starring in various lesser movies
Possibly try a television show
Return to your native country
Take on more serious roles
Rebuild your reputation
Retire on a pile of money

There are some discrepancies among the actresses, but Green, who starred opposite Daniel Craig in "Casino Royale" and now acts on TV's "Camelot", has followed the trajectory to a tee. So yes, a return to France seems imminent. So let's just mention that she is Jewish before she slips from our American consciousness...
cons: Debut in a film in your native country
Win the local Best (Young) Actress award
Get cast in a major Hollywood film
Play the exotic love interest to the English-speaking star
Steal hearts with your exotic accent
Fail to live up to previous success
Be accused in your native country of selling out
Try to hang on by starring in various lesser movies

Retire on a pile of money

There are some discrepancies among the actresses, but Green, who starred opposite Daniel Craig in "Casino Royale" and now acts on TV's "Camelot", has followed the trajectory to a tee. So yes, a return to France seems imminent. So let's just mention that she is Jewish before she slips from our American consciousness...
